greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Theta series of quadratic form x^2 + x*y + 7*y^2.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of theta_3(q) * theta_3(q^27) + theta_2(q) * theta_2(q^27) in powers of q.
Expansion of phi(q) * phi(q^27) + 4 * q^7 * psi(q^2) * psi(q^54) in powers of q where phi(), psi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
a(n) = 2*b(n) where b() is multiplicative with b(3^e) = 3 if e>1, b(p^e) = e+1 if p == 1 (mod 6), b(p^e) = (1 + (-1)^e) / 2 if p == 5 (mod 6).
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (27 t)) = 27^(1/2) (t/i) f(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t).
G.f.: Sum_{i, j in Z} x^(i*i + i*j + 7*j*j).
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < 1, Boole[n == 0], 2 DivisorSum[ n, KroneckerSymbol[ -3, n/#] {1, 1, 0, 1, 1, 0, 1, 1, 3}[[Mod[#, 9, 1]]] &]]; (* _Michael Somos_, Sep 08 2015 *)
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, q] EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, q^27] + EllipticTheta[ 2, 0, q] EllipticTheta[ 2, 0, q^27], {q, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Sep 08 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<0, 0, polcoeff( 1 + 2 * x * Ser(qfrep([2, 1; 1, 14], n, 1)), n))};

(PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( (eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^54 + A))^5 / (eta(x + A) * eta(x^4 + A) * eta(x^27 + A) * eta(x^108 + A))^2 + 4 * x^7 * (eta(x^4 + A) * eta(x^108 + A))^2 / (eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^54 + A)), n))};
(MAGMA) A := Basis( ModularForms( Gamma1(27), 1), 87); A[1] + 2*A[2] + 2*A[5] + 4*A[8] + 6*A[10] + 4*A[14] + 2*A[15]; /* _Michael Somos_, Sep 08 2015 */
